roleset.name: evaluate for cost; assess
roleset.note: VALUE-V NOTES: Former file, value-v.01, based on big corpus, comparison with 'price'. Member of VNcls price-54.4.(fromvalue.01-v)VALUATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, value.01.(from valuation.01-n)

example.name: value-v: transitive/agentive
example.text: PS of New Hampshire values its internal reorganization plan at about $2.2 billion.

example.name: value-v: passive and conjoined
example.text: Advertising time will be valued at more than $75 million in 1990 and $150 million in 1991.

example.name: valuation-n: args 0 and 1
example.text: He maintains that his valuation of the property is fair and reasonable.

example.name: valuation-n: args 1 and 2
example.text: The value of Closing Stock is ascertained by Physical Verification of Stock on the last day of the accounting period andits valuation at Cost or Market Price...

example.name: value-v
example.text: I value him for his offence, but he is to much of a liability defensively and he should be traded.

example.name: valuable-j
example.text: i think this issue is only valuable for the purposes of supporting commoditization of CO2 . that 's my explanation for whyall of the funded scientists point to the gas and build the anthroargument . i do nt see how it is credible in light of more dominantcauses .
example.arg: for the purposes of supporting commoditization of CO2

roleset.name: able to be assigned a cost
roleset.note: VALUABLE-J NOTES: This roleset is only for the 'assign a cost' sense, which is going to be identified by the use of arg2. Ifthere's not an arg2, chances are good that it should be tagged withthe value.02 roleset, which also includes this alias.

example.name: valuable-j: Arg2
example.text: For example, if Coca Cola stock is valuable at $100 a share, it is even more valuable if its share price is reduced to $80 due to bear market conditions.
